abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project outcome is assessed
            as unsatisfactory because the first financial intermediary
            failed and was liquidated during project implementation;
            some funds under the investment component remained
            underutilized; some project sub-components either did not
            materialize or were unsuccessful for a number of reasons
            including inactivity by the agriculture ministry,
            development of institutions providing similar services, and
            political instability; and the technical services unit
            failed to become a sustainable institution and had to be
            closed. Nonetheless, project benefits are considered likely
            to be sustainable, and World Bank performance is rated
            satisfactory. Many of the implementation flaws and delays
            could have been avoided or minimized with a more proactive
            role and timely reaction on the part of the Borrower,
            Borrower performance is adjudged unsatisfactory. Lessons
            learned including the following: As a compromise, it was
            agreed that while technical assistance would be targeted at
            the dairy sector, the credit line would be extended to the
            entire agro-processing sector. In the end, only 12 percent
            of the credit line was on-lent to the dairy industry,
            indicating that it may pay to keep the project flexible to
            help to achieve broader developmental objectives. The
            Albanian Government agreed not to interfere in the
            bank's on-lending; over 400 sub-loans to the Albania
            agro-processing sector were granted at market rates, which
            proved this arrangement viable in Albania.

18156481.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the
            Agro-Processing Development Project is to support the
            development of the agro-processing sector in Albania and to
            help improve the conditions for financing its restructuring
            through the financial sector in order to improve marketing
            of farms outputs (thereby improving rural incomes) and
            availability of food products to urban population. The
            project has two main components: 1) an entrepreneurs support
            component which includes technical assistance, equipment and
            vehicles, and training and study tours; and 2) an investment
            credit component.
